title: NVIDIA GPUs to power Oracle’s next-gen enterprise AI services
optimized_headline: NVIDIA GPUs Set to Transform Oracle's Next-Gen Enterprise AI Services
raw_excerpt:
Oracle and NVIDIA have expanded their partnership to make enterprise AI services more available, powerful, and practical. The announcements, made during Oracle AI World, cover everything from monstrously powerful new hardware to deeply integrated software that aims to put AI at the very core of a company’s data. raw_body:
Oracle and NVIDIA have expanded their partnership to make enterprise AI services more available, powerful, and practical. The announcements, made during Oracle AI World, cover everything from monstrously powerful new hardware to deeply integrated software that aims to put AI at the very core of a company’s data. Ian Buck, VP of Hyperscale and High-Performance […]
The post NVIDIA GPUs to power Oracle’s next-gen enterprise AI services appeared first on AI News.
speedrun: Oracle and NVIDIA are teaming up to enhance enterprise AI services, revealed at Oracle AI World. They plan to integrate powerful NVIDIA GPUs and advanced software to embed AI deeply into business operations. This partnership aims to make AI more accessible and efficient for companies. As businesses increasingly rely on data-driven decisions, the timing of this collaboration is crucial.
why_it_matters: This partnership could directly benefit enterprises looking to leverage AI for improved decision-making and operational efficiency.
It signals a broader trend of tech companies integrating AI into core business functions, potentially reshaping industry standards.

lenses.eli12: Oracle and NVIDIA are joining forces to make AI tools easier for businesses to use. Think of it like upgrading from a basic toolbox to a high-tech workshop. This collaboration could help companies work smarter and make better decisions based on their data.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, this partnership means access to cutting-edge AI capabilities that could enhance product offerings. By integrating powerful GPUs, they could improve efficiency and reduce costs, making AI solutions more viable for various applications.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, this collaboration focuses on integrating NVIDIA's GPUs into Oracle's software, potentially boosting performance for AI applications. The new hardware promises significant improvements in processing power, which could enhance data handling and analysis capabilities for enterprise users.
